text: Hold (or Hauld) is a title of nobility, used in Viking Scandinavia and England. ==History== Holds were described as "noblemen of exalted rank" in Viking Northumbria by Frank Stenton, with a wergild of 4000 thrymsas, equivalent to a king's high-reeve. Hold is described as a title just below the earl in Oxford Dictionary of Surnames. ==References== ==Link== * Eystein Eggen 2005 (Norwegian, Aftenposten) Category:Noble titles Category:Norwegian nobility
title: Hold (title)
